meanings.definition: The plural form of episternum, a plate-like structure in the exoskeleton of some insects.
meanings.sent1: The episterna of the insects provide protection for their bodies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the episterna of insects to understand their anatomy better.
meanings.sent3: The ants had a party on their episterna, pretending it was a dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The episterna of the insects are like tiny shields guarding their delicate bodies.
meanings.sent5: The shiny episterna of the beetles gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The plural form of episternum, a bone in the chest of some vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The episterna in the chest of the animals support their bodies.
meanings.sent2: Veterinarians often check the episterna of vertebrates for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The episterna of the birds were ticklish, making them giggle during the examination.
meanings.sent4: The episterna of the vertebrates are like hidden keys protecting their chests.
meanings.sent5: The strong episterna of the lions stood out against their fur.
